title: 103_hr113
content: The "Buy American Motor Vehicles Act of 1993" aims to boost economic growth by offering a temporary tax credit to encourage the purchase of new domestic passenger vehicles. This credit allows purchasers to reduce the vehicle's purchase price by assigning the credit in exchange. The "Buy American Motor Vehicles Act of 1993" offers a tax credit to individuals purchasing new domestic passenger vehicles. The credit is a percentage of the vehicle's purchase price, with limits on the maximum amount based on the year of purchase. The "Buy American Motor Vehicles Act of 1993" allows individuals to assign their tax credit to the dealer or manufacturer when purchasing a new domestic passenger vehicle. The credit can be used by the manufacturer to offset their tax liability. The "Buy American Motor Vehicles Act of 1993" requires domestic vehicle manufacturers to include information on the label about the vehicle's eligibility for a tax credit and the percentage of parts from domestic manufacturers. The "Buy American Motor Vehicles Act of 1993" mandates that domestic vehicle manufacturers must use at least 60% domestic parts in their production facilities located in the US for interstate sale or export. A "domestic parts manufacturer" is defined as a manufacturer with facilities in the US or Canada. The "Buy American Motor Vehicles Act of 1993" requires domestic vehicle manufacturers to use a minimum of 60% domestic parts in their US production facilities for interstate sale or export. A "domestic parts manufacturer" must have facilities in the United States or Canada and limit the use of materials from related sources to 25% of total production value. The term 'related source' refers to individuals or entities owned or controlled by Japanese citizens. Ownership or control is defined as holding at least 50% of the capital structure in the case of a corporation. The term 'related source' refers to individuals or entities owned or controlled by Japanese citizens, holding at least 50% of the capital structure in the case of a corporation. A domestic parts manufacturer is considered affiliated with a related source if the related source holds at least 2.5% but less than 50% of the capital structure of the manufacturer. Definitions and Special Rules: Purchase price is determined extended to materials, components, and parts used in the production of motor vehicles. Value refers to the cost of these materials, components, or parts to the manufacturer. The term 'United States' includes Puerto Rico and US possessions.. Regulations must be established within 60 days. The Secretary must establish regulations within 60 days to carry out the purposes of this section, including preventing the avoidance of any limitations. This section does not apply to vehicles purchased after December 31, 1994. The amendments made by this section apply to vehicles purchased after December 31, 1992.
